definition: to trade/to carry out commercial activities/in business
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
surname Jing
commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)
Shang Dynasty (c. 1600-1046 BC)/surname Shang
to abandon farming and become a businessman (idiom)

sentences.english: If you want your blog to make money, treat it like a business.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想用你的博客来赚钱，就像经商一样对待它吧。

sentences.english: He only traded for a few months and went out of business because he was undercapitalized.
sentences.chinese: 他仅经商数月，便由于投资不足而歇业。

sentences.english: In Tang dynasty, the phenomenon of bureaucracy trading was becoming more serious.
sentences.chinese: 有唐一代，官员经商已成为一个严重的社会问题。

sentences.english: Many teachers have switched to business because of the temptation of the high returns.
sentences.chinese: 在高薪的利诱之下，许多教师都改行经商了。

sentences.english: It’s no easy job to set out in business.
My classmate has made lots of money since he quit his job and ventured into business last year.
sentences.chinese: 我同学去年辞职下海经商后挣了大钱。

sentences.english: It was an approach to business that was fresh and appealing to me.
sentences.chinese: 这样的经商态度令我耳目一新，也为之心折。

sentences.english: After he failed in business, his family had great difficulty keeping up an appearance.
sentences.chinese: 他经商失败以后，他一家人想摆阔便感力不从心了。

sentences.english: He'll need to sharpen his brain a bit if he hopes to get on in business.
sentences.chinese: 如果他想下海经商，他还得头脑更精明些。

sentences.english: Business-friendly immigration reform might just qualify.
sentences.chinese: 方便经商的移民改革即是可能性之一。

sentences.english: They have engaged in trade for many years.
Singapore now ranks as the No. 1 country for ease of doing business, with a top tax rate of 20%.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡已成为经商环境的宽松度全球排名第一的国家。

sentences.english: Mr Grate just entered on a business career.
sentences.chinese: 格罗特先生刚开始经商。

sentences.english: The only thing we could do was business.
sentences.chinese: 过去，我们唯一能做的事就是经商。

sentences.english: (Applause.) We have to make America the best place on Earth to do business.
sentences.chinese: 我们要使美国成为这个地球上最适宜经商的地方。

sentences.english: Many teachers quit their jobs and go into business under the temptation of high salary .
sentences.chinese: 在高薪的利诱之下，许多教师都改行经商了。

definition: to do business
to buy and sell/to do business/to trade/to deal
merchant/businessman
to take an official post/to become a government employee
to lay down a family fortune/to get rich/to become prosperous
to seek one's livelihood/to work to support oneself/to earn a living
to look for a job/to seek employment
to settle (in some city, country etc)/to take up residence
to build up from nothing/to start from scratch
to make one's mark/to go up in the world/to make one's fortune
to earn a living
(coll.) job/work
to become rich/enrichment
farming/to work the land
to get rich
to eke out a living/to live from hand to mouth/to drift aimlessly
enormous sum/millionaire/very rich
